nodes.text: Hello there Slim. My name’s . Why do you call this Trapper Town?
Oh, you mean a GECK. huh? Well, I saw an ad for one of those in an old magazine. But I don’t think they exist anymore. Certainly not around here, anyplace.

We blocked off all the entrances to the north side of town except one. I have a key to that one entrance -- just in case anyone needs to get over there for any reason. I can’t figure out why anyone would want to, though; I sure wouldn’t.
Your tribe are mostly farmers aren’t they? I don’t think I could teach you a darn thing.

People been disappearing. Just them as are slow and sickly, for now. 'Course, they don't stop to cook their food like us. They just gnaw it into a few bloody clumps of hair and rags. Least that's all we find in the morning. I've even heard talk that there's some kind of giant rat god that tells 'em all what to do.

The golden ones are sneaky and twice as vicious as the regular ones. Plus, once they bite you they’ll hold on and gnaw through to the bone. And that’s not even counting their poison. But their hides look real nice, and so they’re worth a lot more.
I don’t think I’d try it if I were you. You might get your hands all dirty and callused. (heh, hee, hee) Anything else you want to know about?
Well, I guess you didn’t need that key as much as you thought, huh? You sure you got what you  wanted?
You’re interested in trapping, huh? (He looks you up and down.)

Well they taste pretty good if you spit-roast 'em with just a titch of herbs. But most of the time they can be a real nuisance, and they're getting worse. We've barricaded the north side of town but they're sneaking through anyway. There's one door to the north side, right here, but I have it locked.
I’m always happy to share my skill with others. I can teach you some tricks for only $50.
Just be careful. Seems the deeper you go, the bigger they get back there.

Maybe he found where they come from and got all ate up. (heh, hee, hee) But I tell you one thing; Mrs. Buckner’s heart just about broke when he didn’t come back. You see, he was her beau. Mrs. Buckner runs Buckner house, y’know.
Hello there, my name’s Slim Picket. I speak for this part of town. (point at self) Me

Say, your antenna don't pick up all the channels do it? Well, I tell you what. Here's a key to that door behind me. There's all kinds of rats back there - even one big one s'posedly. You go through there and kill all the dang rats you can eat. How's that?
What did you want to know about?
Well, that ought to have learned you a thing or three about the great out-of-doors. Hope you can put it to good use. Remember about the scat now.
Hello there, my name’s Slim Picket. I speak for this part of town. , me hungry
You still want that key? Why?
One real good trapper, name of Smiley, went north looking for wherever they come from. He was convinced that they all came from one place. Thing is, nobody’s heard from him for a couple months now.
Hello there, friend. Nice of you to visit all of us here. My name’s Slim Picket. I talk for Trapper Town.
I just don’t want to have anything to do with those critters. I leave ‘em alone and hope they’ll do the same for me. Take care now.
Hi there. How can I help you out?
Well, now you look like you could handle yourself. Geckos come in two types -— regular or golden. The regular ones are easy to trap and hunt, but the golden ones are worth more money.
If you want the key, you’re going to have to buy it from me.
I guess you got what you wanted. Just be careful now.
Well, little missy, you sure don’t look chewed up by those rats yet -- but you will if you keep pestering them. Just don’t bring any back here with you.

We have a whole lot full of cars. All ready for their owners to come back from shopping. Thing is, they never did. Not a dang one of ‘em runs, though. There’s a real beauty of a Chrysalis Motors Highwayman just east of here, but I haven’t figured out how to get to it, yet.

links.text: Do you know where I could find something called a Garden of Eden Creation Kit?
Nice to meet you, Mr. Picket. I’m just looking around for now, though. Goodbye.
Really? Well, tell me about something else then.
Oh, well; that’s all I wanted to know. Thanks.
Interesting; tell me something else.
I’m interested in getting that key from you.
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
I think I’ll be going then. Goodbye.
I’m that good already, huh? Well, tell me about something else then.
Interesting. Tell me about something else.
Interesting. Maybe someone should do something about that. Say, do you have a key to the north side of Trapper Town?
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
Tell me more.
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
I sure wish I was as skillful a trapper as you are. I bet you could teach me a lot.
Well, I sure wouldn’t want to get my hands dirty. Tell me something else.
Hey, Slim, I have a couple of things that I wanted to ask you about.
Oops; I knew there was something else I wanted.
I don’t need anything else from you. Thanks anyhow.
[MORE]
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
At home mom just used to pan-fry them with a little butter. But, tell me more about  the rat attacks.
Well, you better have a lot to teach me for that.
I don’t think I need to learn anything right now. Goodbye.
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
Interesting. Tell me something else.
No! Rats scaaarrrry! No. Me go now.
OK. Heh, heh, rat kill. Heh, heh, heh.
Do you ever go to the north side?
Do you know anything about a Garden of Eden Creation Kit?
Thanks for the info. I don’t think I need to know about anything else. Goodbye.
You sure have a lot of cars here.
Tell me about trapping geckos.
Thanks for the information, Slim. I’m going to go and practice right now. Goodbye.
Thank you for all the tips, Slim, but I still think just smelling the scat is good enough. I was wondering about something else, though.
You’re right. Old scat doesn’t taste near the same as fresh. Thanks, Slim. Now tell me more  about those geckos.
I guess I wouldn’t want a key. It sounds as though it’s pretty dangerous over there.
I’m an explorer; I want to explore everyplace I can. Besides, maybe there’s a GECK forgotten on a back shelf in there.
What do you think happened to him?
Do you know where I could find something called a Garden of Eden Creation Kit?
Nice to meet you, Mr. Picket. I’m just looking around for now, though. Goodbye.
I guess I don’t need anything. Goodbye.
Interesting. Tell me something else.
Tell me more about the golden geckos.
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
I don’t want to trade for the key. It won’t cost you anything to let me borrow it. I’ll make sure to close the door after myself.
I don’t mind trading for the key.
I don’t think I want the key. Goodbye.
Thanks.
Uh, ok.
No, thanks to you.
Don’t worry. I won’t.
A Highwayman? Interesting. Tell me about something else.
That’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye.
